simple.util.logging

Class LogFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.util.logging.LogFactory

  • public final class LogFactory
extends Object
    Factory for getting and setting logs for specific classes.
    Getting a log: getLogFor(Class), getLogFor(Object)
    Standard way of getting a log:
    Setting a log: private static final Log log = LogFactory.getLogFor(<your class>.class)
    • setGlobalLogFile(File, boolean)
    • setGlobalLogStream(PrintStream)
    • setLogFileFor(Class, File, boolean)
    • setLogStreamFor(Class, PrintStream)
    • setLogFor(Class, Log)
    You can change the log for a class after it has been gotten. Messages logged before the change will not be transferred.
    Created: Oct 21, 2010
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce
    See Also:
    Log

      • setLogStreamFor

        Parameters:
        clazz -
        stream -

      • setGlobalLogFile

        public static void setGlobalLogFile(File file,
                    boolean append)
                             throws IOException
        Sets the global output file for all log streams created by this factory. Also updates existing logs.
        Parameters:
        file - target file
        append - append to the file or clear it
        Throws:
        IOException - if file creation fails.
        See Also:
        File.createNewFile()

      • getErrorString

        public static final String getErrorString(int code)
        Gets the String associated with the code from the error code resolver. Short for LogFactory.getECR().getErrorString(code).
        Parameters:
        code - The error code.
        Returns:
        The error string associated with the error code.
